etymology.interpretation: Pairs the auspicious phoenix with pear to label an exotic fruit whose crown suggests a bird’s crest. Follows a common pattern of naming new fruits by likening them to familiar ones.
etymology.simplification: 鳳 was simplified to 凤 in PRC reforms by removing/streamlining the bird component to reduce strokes; 梨 is unchanged.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢喝凤梨汁(我喜歡喝鳳梨汁)。
examples.english: I like to drink pineapple juice.

examples.chinese: 台湾人常说凤梨，大陆多说菠萝(臺灣人常說鳳梨，大陸多說菠蘿)。
examples.pinyin: Táiwān rén cháng shuō fènglí, Dàlù duō shuō bōluó.
examples.english: People in Taiwan often say fènglí, while on the Mainland they mostly say bōluó.

examples.chinese: 一颗成熟的凤梨闻起来很香(一顆成熟的鳳梨聞起來很香)。
examples.pinyin: Yì kē chéngshú de fènglí wén qǐlái hěn xiāng.
examples.english: A ripe pineapple smells very fragrant.
